result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Charles A Evans

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Charles A Evans not in court, in custody.  Attorney Melissa Jane Fitzsimmons Ms appeared by video for Charles A Evans.  Prosecuting attorney Foley J. Van Lieshout Ms. in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
CASE HEARD OFF THE RECORD DUE TO COURT REPORTER AVAILABILITY.
Court waived defendant's appearance.
Defense counsel has received an offer. Discussion held. Defendant has a felony matter (22CF2292) and will be seeking a global offer and request the court to authorize transfer.
Court authorizes transfer to Branch 2 for purposes of a global resolution, if accepted.   
Defense requested adjournment of proceedings. Court grants request. Case remains calendared in Branch 15.
This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.
Status conference scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Charles A Evans not in court, in custody.  Attorney Melissa Jane Fitzsimmons Ms in court for Charles A Evans.  Prosecuting attorney Navjot Singh Hira in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a scheduling conference. Defendant's appearance is waived. State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law. Defendant has a lower pending felony matter 22CF2292 that is scheduled on 09-26-2022. Counsel requests a scheduling conference to allow time to speak with client regarding both matters to determine case posture. Case remains calendared in Branch 15.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Melissa Jane Fitzsimmons in court, defendant Charles A Evans not in court, in custody.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
OFF THE RECORD:  Case in court for a Scheduling Conference. Defendant is in custody at the House of Correction. 
Defense counsel request a date after defendant  preliminary hearing pending felony case ( 22CF2292). Granted by the Court.
Effective  July 30, 2022  this calendar will be assigned to Judge JD Watts, Branch 15  in Room 623 of the Courthouse.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Charles Alexander Evans not in court, defendant in custody. Julie Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 Case set for Scheduling Conference on 6-27-2022. State Public Defenders Office needs more time to appoint counsel. 
Court ordered case adjourned back to Branch 19. Status of Counsel scheduled July 26, 2022 at 8:30am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Marshalls; Pick N Save; Walgreens
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.

Defendant Charles A Evans in court with attorney Amanda M. Parent.  Defendant Charles A Evans in custody.  Joshua Milder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Charles A Evans appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant has lower number case 21CM583 pending.  Defendant is advised this case is reassigned to Judge Ashley, Branch 19. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned to Br. 19 for pretrial.  
This hearing may be streamed live through DACAST at the Court's discretion: https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/21a87aec-ffb6-5325-fb81-55812563aa79  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.
